240.question: What was the performance of both approaches on their dataset?
240.response: {'Answer': 'The x-vector system outperformed the i-vector system on both the SITW and CN-Celeb evaluation datasets. For the CN-Celeb(E) evaluation set, the best x-vector performance was 11.99% EER when trained on CN-Celeb(T) and using VoxCeleb as the backend, while the best i-vector performance was 11.34% EER when trained on CN-Celeb(T) with VoxCeleb as the backend. However, when both systems were trained and evaluated on the VoxCeleb dataset, the x-vector achieved better performance with a 4
240.answer: ERR of 19.05 with i-vectors and 15.52 with x-vectors

242.question: What genres are covered?
242.response: {'Answer': 'Entertainment, Interview, Singing, Play, Movie, Vlog, Live Broadcast, Speech, Drama, Recitation, Advertisement'}
242.answer: genre, entertainment, interview, singing, play, movie, vlog, live broadcast, speech, drama, recitation and advertisement

244.question: Which of the two speech recognition models works better overall on CN-Celeb?

245.question: By how much is performance on CN-Celeb inferior to performance on VoxCeleb?
245.response: {'Answer': 'For the i-vector system, it ranges from 1.20 to 7.25, and for the x-vector system, it ranges from 6.74 to 7.84.'}
245.answer: For i-vector system, performances are 11.75% inferior to voxceleb. For x-vector system, performances are 10.74% inferior to voxceleb
